bibl.idno: The Papers of Henry Rose Carter [manuscript] ; HEALTHSCI MS-10.

bibl.title: Letter from Frederick F. Russell to Henry Rose Carter, September 11, 1923

div1.p: Russell sends Carter medical reports and asks for his opinion on a case that was diagnosed as yellow fever ante mortem.

div1.head: Letter from Frederick F. Russell to Henry Rose Carter, September 11, 1923
div1.opener:
ADMINISTRATIVE STAFF
FREDERICK F. RUSSELL, M.D.
GENERAL DIRECTOR
JOHN A. FERRELL, M.D.
DIRECTOR FOR
THE UNITED STATES
VICTOR G. HEISER, M.D.
DIRECTOR FOR
THE EAST
H. H. HOWARD, M.D.
DIRECTOR FOR
THE WEST INDIES
INTERNATIONAL HEALTH BOARD
OF
THE ROCKEFELLER FOUNDATION
61 BROADWAY, NEW YORK
CABLE ADDRESS “INTERCOM”
MEMBERS
GEORGE E. VINCENT
CHAIRMAN
WALLACE BUTTRICK
DAVID L. EDSALL
SIMON FLEXNER
RAYMOND B. FOSDICK
EDWIN O. JORDAN
VERNON KELLOGG
T. MITCHELL PRUDDEN
JOHN D. ROCKEFELLER, JR.
WICKLIFFE ROSE
VICTOR C. VAUGHAN
WILLIAM H. WELCH
EDWIN R. EMBREE
SECRETARY
FLORENCE M. READ
ASSISTANT SECRETARY
September 11, 1923
Dear Doctor Carter:
div1.p:
You will find enclosed reports concerning the case
of Senor Luis V. Corona from Mr. H. B. Richardson, Doctor
J. M. Herrera, Doctor Miguel Galindo, and Doctor Ciro Hurtado.
Senor Corona died at Colima August 21st, 1923. Doctor
Hurtado was the attending physician, and Doctor Galindo
performed the autopsy. The case was diagnosed ante mortem
as yellow fever, but the diagnosis was questioned by the
sanitary delegate. We should like to know what you think
about it.
div1.closer:
Very sincerely yours, FFRussell Doctor H. R. Carter
Badin Hospital
Badin
North Carolina
FMR:EP E
